awd_titl_txt: Presidential Young Investigator Award: Fundamental Studies  of Droplet Evaporation
awd_abstract_narration: The research is directed toward studying several fundamental problems           associated with evaporation of liquid droplets.  The information                obtained contributes to an understanding of factors affecting droplet           evaporation rates, and is relevant to more fundamental problems                 associated with homogeneous nucleation, bubble growth within                    superheated liquids, and Leidenfrost boiling of droplets.  Specific             problems being studied are:  homogeneous nucleation and bubble growth           within droplets which are miscible mixtures of liquids at elevated              pressures; evaporation of liquid droplets on hot/porous ceramic                 surfaces; and combustion of droplets in near-zero gravity.  The                 emphasis is on experiment, though some analyses are also performed.             The principal means of data acquisition is photographic.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
